channel.title: Pitch and Play
channel.itunes:author: Pitch and Play
channel.description: A podcast about actually playing the games your friends recommend.
channel.itunes:summary: A podcast about actually playing the games your friends recommend.

item.title: The Sims Bustin' Out
item.itunes:title: The Sims Bustin' Out
item.description: Visit SimValley and meet your demise at the hands of the Veloci-Rooster.
item.content:encoded:
We’re back! After a missed week due to Life™, Cassie and Ross sit down to discuss The Sims Bustin’ Out on the GameBoy Advance, a childhood favorite of Cassie’s! They focus on the design of the game, how the developers met the challenge (or didn’t meet) of adapting a PC game to a handheld format, and the general hilarity of the dialogue and storytelling.

We do not have a pitch attached to this episode as Cassie is still working on Dragon Age! You can hear her thoughts on the first third of the game on a previous episode.
item.itunes:summary:

item.itunes:subtitle: Visit SimValley and meet your demise at the hands of the Veloci-Rooster.

item.title: The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom (Part 2)
item.itunes:title: The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom (Part 2)
item.content:encoded: This week on Pitch & Play we break our format yet again to talk more about The Legend of Zelda: Tears of Kingdom because it’s our podcast and we make the rules, OK? Cassie and Ross invite special guest Joe, known Breath of the Wild fan, to gush about Nintendo’s latest release and how we just want to spend all of our time in the depths. Cassie closes the episode by pitching yet another banger to Ross, The Sims Bustin’ Out for GBA, which he is sure to like and enjoy.
item.itunes:summary: This week on Pitch & Play we break our format yet again to talk more about The Legend of Zelda: Tears of Kingdom because it’s our podcast and we make the rules, OK? Cassie and Ross invite special guest Joe, known Breath of the Wild fan, to gush about Nintendo’s latest release and how we just want to spend all of our time in the depths. Cassie closes the episode by pitching yet another banger to Ross, The Sims Bustin’ Out for GBA, which he is sure to like and enjoy.
item.itunes:subtitle: As above, so below.

item.title: Dragon Age: Origins & The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom
item.itunes:title: Dragon Age: Origins & The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom
item.description: A double threat of an episode!
item.content:encoded: This week on Pitch & Play we change up the format a little! We check in on Cassie’s progress on Dragon Age: Origins, which is about a third of the way through (Alistair is the worst). We then turn our attention to The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom, discussing our feelings on Breath of the Wild and our very early impressions on how the sequel remedies much of our pain points with it.
item.itunes:summary: This week on Pitch & Play we change up the format a little! We check in on Cassie’s progress on Dragon Age: Origins, which is about a third of the way through (Alistair is the worst). We then turn our attention to The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom, discussing our feelings on Breath of the Wild and our very early impressions on how the sequel remedies much of our pain points with it.
item.itunes:subtitle: A double threat of an episode!

item.title: Tony Hawk's American Wasteland
item.itunes:title: Tony Hawk's American Wasteland
item.content:encoded: This week on Pitch & Play, Cassie abuses her privileges of forcing others to play games she likes by making Ross play Tony Hawk’s American Wasteland and relives her childhood fantasies of being a cool skateboarder instead of a boring adult. Ross and Cassie dig into the (admittedly sparse) narrative, at times bloated gameplay, and dope soundtrack (can you guess who writes these summaries?). Ross then pitches Dragon Age Origins to Cassie. Our pitch for Dragon Age is extra long as Cassie and Ross attempt to tease out the “best” way to approach a large BioWare RPG — especially one that has been a long time coming for Cassie.
item.itunes:summary: This week on Pitch & Play, Cassie abuses her privileges of forcing others to play games she likes by making Ross play Tony Hawk’s American Wasteland and relives her childhood fantasies of being a cool skateboarder instead of a boring adult. Ross and Cassie dig into the (admittedly sparse) narrative, at times bloated gameplay, and dope soundtrack (can you guess who writes these summaries?). Ross then pitches Dragon Age Origins to Cassie. Our pitch for Dragon Age is extra long as Cassie and Ross attempt to tease out the “best” way to approach a large BioWare RPG — especially one that has been a long time coming for Cassie.
item.itunes:subtitle: Welcome to the Wasteland.

item.title: Rise of the Tomb Raider
item.itunes:title: Rise of the Tomb Raider
item.description: We become who we're meant to be.
item.content:encoded: This episode of Pitch & Play covers Rise of the Tomb Raider, the second game in the Tomb Raider “Survivor Trilogy.” Cassie and Ross review the at times incoherent (but nevertheless entertaining) narrative, gameplay loop, and expansive side content. Cassie then recommends a game to Ross for our next episode: Tony Hawk’s American Wasteland.
item.itunes:summary: This episode of Pitch & Play covers Rise of the Tomb Raider, the second game in the Tomb Raider “Survivor Trilogy.” Cassie and Ross review the at times incoherent (but nevertheless entertaining) narrative, gameplay loop, and expansive side content. Cassie then recommends a game to Ross for our next episode: Tony Hawk’s American Wasteland.
item.itunes:subtitle: We become who we're meant to be.

item.title: The Order 1886
item.itunes:title: The Order 1886
item.description: The wall dividing life and death is so thin.
item.content:encoded: This week on Pitch & Play, Ross follows through on Cassie’s recommendation to play the beleaguered PlayStation 4 exclusive The Order 1886. The two discuss the potential in the premise of the game, its incredible graphics (that still hold up in 2023!), and ultimate failure to deliver a satisfying end product. The episode concludes with Ross’s pitch to Cassie for the next episode, Rise of the Tomb Raider, the second game in the Tomb Raider “Survivor Trilogy.”
item.itunes:summary: This week on Pitch & Play, Ross follows through on Cassie’s recommendation to play the beleaguered PlayStation 4 exclusive The Order 1886. The two discuss the potential in the premise of the game, its incredible graphics (that still hold up in 2023!), and ultimate failure to deliver a satisfying end product. The episode concludes with Ross’s pitch to Cassie for the next episode, Rise of the Tomb Raider, the second game in the Tomb Raider “Survivor Trilogy.”
item.itunes:subtitle: The wall dividing life and death is so thin.

item.title: The Legend of Zelda: A Link to the Past
item.itunes:title: The Legend of Zelda: A Link to the Past
item.description: Things in the light are not the same in the dark and neither are games from thirty years ago.
item.content:encoded: This week on Pitch & Play, we have our first DNF (“Did Not Finish”): Cassie fails to get through A Link to the Past but still finds it within herself to recommend The Order 1886 to Ross.
item.itunes:summary: This week on Pitch & Play, we have our first DNF (“Did Not Finish”): Cassie fails to get through A Link to the Past but still finds it within herself to recommend The Order 1886 to Ross.
item.itunes:subtitle: Things in the light are not the same in the dark and neither are games from thirty years ago.

item.title: Fable Anniversary
item.itunes:title: Fable Anniversary
item.content:encoded: In this episode of Pitch & Play, an episode about actually playing the games your friends recommend, Ross plays Fable Anniversary, a re-release of Lionhead’s Fable (2004). Ross then pitches our next game to Cassie, The Legend of Zelda: A Link to the Past.
item.itunes:summary: In this episode of Pitch & Play, an episode about actually playing the games your friends recommend, Ross plays Fable Anniversary, a re-release of Lionhead’s Fable (2004). Ross then pitches our next game to Cassie, The Legend of Zelda: A Link to the Past.
item.itunes:subtitle: For Every Choice, A Consequence

item.title: Vampire Survivors
item.itunes:title: Vampire Survivors
item.description: The supernatural indie phenomenon that lets you be the bullet hell!
item.content:encoded: In this episode of Pitch & Play, an episode about actually playing the games your friends recommend, Cassie plays Vampire Survivors, the game Ross pitched last episode. Our hosts then give a brief update on their thoughts on Immortality, and Cassie pitches Fable Anniversary to Ross for our next episode.
item.itunes:summary: In this episode of Pitch & Play, an episode about actually playing the games your friends recommend, Cassie plays Vampire Survivors, the game Ross pitched last episode. Our hosts then give a brief update on their thoughts on Immortality, and Cassie pitches Fable Anniversary to Ross for our next episode.
item.itunes:subtitle: The supernatural indie phenomenon that lets you be the bullet hell!

item.title: Stardew Valley
item.itunes:title: Stardew Valley
item.description: In our full-length discussion of Stardew Valley, Cassie tries to find ways to convince Ross that Stardew Valley can work for him.
item.content:encoded: This week’s episode of Pitch & Play, a podcast about actually playing the games your friends recommend, Ross shares his experiences with Stardew Valley. Cassie tries to find ways to make the game “work” for him, and we close on Ross pitching Vampire Survivors to Cassie.
item.itunes:summary: This week’s episode of Pitch & Play, a podcast about actually playing the games your friends recommend, Ross shares his experiences with Stardew Valley. Cassie tries to find ways to make the game “work” for him, and we close on Ross pitching Vampire Survivors to Cassie.
item.itunes:subtitle: In our full-length discussion of Stardew Valley, Cassie tries to find ways to convince Ross that Stardew Valley can work for him.

item.title: Immortality
item.itunes:title: Immortality
item.description: In this spoiler-filled discussion of Immortality, Cassie and Ross discuss their struggles with the presentation of the game and accessing the game's narrative.
item.content:encoded: This week’s episode of Pitch & Play, a podcast about actually playing the games your friends recommend, includes our spoiler-filled discussion of Sam Barlow’s latest joint, Immortality (2022). Cassie and Ross discuss their struggles with the presentation of the game and the accessibility of the game’s story. Not interested in hearing about Immortality? Skip to the chapter marker to hear about our game for next week, as Cassie pitches her “warm blanket” game to Ross, Stardew Valley.

item.title: Introduction
item.itunes:title: Introduction
item.description: Welcome to the first episode of Pitch and Play, a podcast about actually playing the games that your friends recommend!
item.content:encoded: Welcome to the first episode of Pitch & Play, a podcast about actually playing the games that your friends recommend! In this episode, Cassie and Ross introduce themselves and explain the backgrounds and perspectives that they each will bring to our discussions of games. Ross then pitches our first game to Cassie, Immortality (2022).
item.itunes:summary: Welcome to the first episode of Pitch & Play, a podcast about actually playing the games that your friends recommend! Ross then pitches our first game to Cassie, Immortality (2022).
item.itunes:subtitle: Welcome to the first episode of Pitch and Play, a podcast about actually playing the games that your friends recommend!
